name: ISA-95 Model
description: ISA-95 (ANSI/ISA-95 / IEC 62264) is an international standard for enterprise-control system integration. It defines the interface between enterprise systems and control systems, focusing on information exchange and manufacturing operations management.

Level_0.name: Physical Processes
Level_0.description: The actual physical processes being controlled

Level_1.name: Sensing and Manipulation
Level_1.description: Sensing the physical process and manipulating the process

Level_2.name: Monitoring and Supervisory Control
Level_2.description: Monitoring, supervisory control and automated control of the production process
Level_2.scope: Batch control, continuous control (seconds to hours)

Level_3.name: Manufacturing Operations Management
Level_3.description: Work flow/recipe control to produce the desired end products. Maintains records and optimizes production

Level_4.name: Business Planning and Logistics
Level_4.description: Enterprise resource planning, supply chain management, and business-related activities

allowed_communications.rationale: Control systems exchange data with supervisory systems
Supervisory systems interface with MES for production management
MES integrates with ERP for business operations

prohibited_communications.rationale: ERP systems should not directly control production equipment
Business systems must never interact with physical processes

required_enforcement_points.rationale: Critical integration point - requires data transformation and security
Enterprise-control boundary - requires business logic separation
